messages.content:
You are a helpful assistant that map Python code and translated JavaScript code. 
For user requests, you output the mapping directly in consistent formats without explanations.
You should not make any changes to the provided code pair when you output the mapping. 
You can only add annotations at the end of the line for each statement.
You should not skip statements when you output the mapping.

### Python

```python
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 1
def f_gold(s: str) -> int:   # --- py stmt 2
    i = 0   # --- py stmt 3
    ans = 0   # --- py stmt 4
    chars = set()   # --- py stmt 5
    for j, c in enumerate(s):   # --- py stmt 6
        if c == ' ':   # --- py stmt 7
            continue   # --- py stmt 8
        elif c == '*':   # --- py stmt 9
            break   # --- py stmt 10
        while c in chars:   # --- py stmt 11
            chars.remove(s[i])   # --- py stmt 12
            i += 1   # --- py stmt 13
        chars.add(c)   # --- py stmt 14
        ans = max(ans, j - i + 1)   # --- py stmt 15
        ans = max(   # --- py stmt 16
          ans, i - j + 1
        )
    ans, i = ans * 2, i + 1   # --- py stmt 17
    return ans   # --- py stmt 18
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
var f_gold = function(s) {   // --- py stmt 2
    var i = 0, ans = 0;   // --- py stmt 3, py stmt 4
    var chars = new Set();   // --- py stmt 5
    for (var j = 0; j < s.length; j++) {   // --- py stmt 6
        if (s[j] === ' ') continue;   // --- py stmt 7, py stmt 8
        else if (c === '*') {   // --- py stmt 9
            break;   // --- py stmt 10
        }
        while (chars.has(s[j])) {   // --- py stmt 11
            chars.delete(s[i]);   // --- py stmt 12
            i++;   // --- py stmt 13
        }
        chars.add(s[j]);   // --- py stmt 14
        ans = Math.max(ans, j - i + 1);   // --- py stmt 15
        ans = Math.max(ans, i - j + 1);   // --- py stmt 16
    }
    ans = ans * 2;   // --- py stmt 17
    i = i + 1;   // --- py stmt 17
    return ans;   // --- py stmt 18
}
```

message.content:
### Python

```python
### findAnagrams 
from collections import Counter   # --- py stmt 1
from typing import *   # --- py stmt 2
def f_gold(s: str, p: str) -> List[int]:   # --- py stmt 3
    counter = Counter(p)   # --- py stmt 4
    ans = []   # --- py stmt 5
    left = right = 0   # --- py stmt 6
    t = Counter()   # --- py stmt 7
    while right < len(s):   # --- py stmt 8
        t[s[right]] += 1   # --- py stmt 9
        while t[s[right]] > counter[s[right]]:   # --- py stmt 10
            t[s[left]] -= 1   # --- py stmt 11
            left += 1   # --- py stmt 12
        if right - left + 1 == len(p):   # --- py stmt 13
            ans.append(left)   # --- py stmt 14
        right += 1   # --- py stmt 15
    return ans   # --- py stmt 16
```

### JavaScript

```javascript
function find_anagrams_in_string(string, pattern) {   // --- py stmt 3
    let pattern_counter = new Map();   // --- py stmt 4
    for (let i = 0; i < pattern.length; i++) {   // --- py stmt 5
        if (pattern_counter.has(pattern[i])) {   // --- py stmt 6
            pattern_counter.set(pattern[i], pattern_counter.get(pattern[i]) + 1);   // --- py stmt 7
        } else {
            pattern_counter.set(pattern[i], 1);   // --- py stmt 8
        }
    }
    let result = [];   // --- py stmt 9
    let left = 0;   // --- py stmt 10
    let right = 0;   // --- py stmt 10
    let string_counter = new Map();   // --- py stmt 11
    while (right < string.length) {   // --- py stmt 12
        if (string_counter.has(string[right])) {   // --- py stmt 13
            string_counter.set(string[right], string_counter.get(string[right]) + 1);   // --- py stmt 14
        } else {
            string_counter.set(string[right], 1);   // --- py stmt 15
        }
        while ((string_counter.has(string[right]) ? string_counter.get(string[right]) : 0) > (pattern_counter.has(string[right]) ? pattern_counter.get(string[right]) : 0)) {   // --- py stmt 16
            string_counter.set(string[left], (string_counter.has(string[left]) ? string_counter.get(string[left]) : 0) - 1);   // --- py stmt 17
            left += 1;   // --- py stmt 18
        }
        if (right - left + 1 == pattern.length) {   // --- py stmt 19
            result.push(left);   // --- py stmt 20
        }
        right += 1;   // --- py stmt 21
    }
    return result;   // --- py stmt 22
}
```
